title: Onam
short_description: Kerala's most colorful 10-day harvest festival, featuring snake boat races, flower rangolis, and the grand feast.
long_description:
Onam is the state festival of Kerala, a grand ten-day spectacle that unites Malayalis across religious lines. It celebrates the homecoming of the mythical King Mahabali, a benevolent ruler whose spirit is believed to visit his subjects annually. The festival transforms the lush green state into a riot of colors starting with 'Pookkalam', intricate flower carpets designed in front of every home.

The highlight for travelers is the Vallam Kali (Snake Boat Race), where long, narrow boats powered by hundreds of singing oarsmen slice through the backwaters—a display of strength and rhythm. Another essential experience is the 'Onam Sadhya', a vegetarian feast of 26+ dishes served on a banana leaf. From the tiger dances (Pulikali) where joyously pot-bellied men paint themselves as tigers to the serene temple rituals, Onam captures the essence of Kerala's rich heritage.
significance: Honors the golden rule of King Mahabali and celebrates the rice harvest.
key_rituals: Vallam Kali: The adrenaline-pumping snake boat races.
Onam Sadhya: The grand multi-course vegetarian feast.
Pulikali: The 'Play of the Tigers' street performance.

top_places.best_to_experience: The wild and colorful Pulikali (Tiger Dance) procession.

top_places.title: Kochi
top_places.best_to_experience: Thrikkakara Temple celebrations (associated with legendary Mahabali).

top_places.title: Trivandrum
top_places.best_to_experience: Illuminations throughout the city and daily cultural programs.

practical_info.dress_tips: Women wear the cream and gold 'Kasavu' saree. Men wear the 'Mundu'. Dressing up is part of the fun.
practical_info.safety_tips: Boat races attract massive crowds; arrive hours early for a spot.

faqs.a: Absolutely! Most hotels and restaurants serve the special Sadhya feast during Onam. Eating with your hands is the custom.

faqs.q: When is the best boat race?
faqs.a: The Nehru Trophy Boat Race usually happens on the second Saturday of August, kicking off the season.
